reviews.text:
Apr 25
Lunch 3 of us

First time eating at this branch.

Layout and ambience ok. Cleanliness good. It s work day so not too crowded.

Service attentive and prompt. Though all orders using apps but they still help with questions.

Foods and drinks:
- the galao is nice especially if you are looking for something non sugar.
- the new menu honey thigh chicken bowl also very nice. Adequate portion with good sides add ons
- sweet potato fries just too yummy cant stop once you start

Overall it is very nice and a good option if you are hungry at bugis junction mall.

The three of us had the two piece thigh and the meal for two.  The chicken and all the sides taste good.  The meal for two comes with two free flow drinks.  So we need to pay extra for another drink.

The staff were friendly and provided pretty fast service.
It's very delicious, though slightly pricey (speaking as a student). I enjoyed the sweet potato fries a lot (not pictured). It's a nice place to share a meal with friends and/or family!

Nando's Bugis Junction ‚Äì Where Chickens Go on a Diet Before Serving

We went to Nando‚Äôs at Bugis Junction with stomachs rumbling and expectations high, hoping for a hearty, soul-warming meal. After all, when you‚Äôre forking out $16.30 for boneless chicken thighs, you‚Äôd expect at least, well‚Ä¶ a decent amount of chicken. Right?

What arrived at the table looked like something you‚Äôd find hiding behind the lettuce in a sad school lunchbox. The so-called "chicken thighs" could‚Äôve passed for chicken thoughts‚Äîsmall, fleeting, and barely there. Blink and you might miss them. Or maybe that was the point: a culinary magic trick. Now you see it, now you're still hungry.

Let‚Äôs be clear. For $16.30, I wasn‚Äôt expecting a whole farmyard experience, but I also wasn‚Äôt expecting appetizers for ants. Honestly, I‚Äôve had more meat fall off a KFC drumstick I dropped on the floor.

The photos speak for themselves, but just to paint the picture: imagine paying steakhouse prices and receiving a snack-sized portion that would leave even a toddler asking, ‚ÄúIs that all?‚Äù At this point, I‚Äôd have had a more fulfilling experience (emotionally and nutritionally) at a fast food chain‚Äîand still walked away with change for dessert.

In conclusion: if you're looking to pay premium prices for portion sizes that would make a hamster complain, Nando‚Äôs Bugis Junction is your spot. Otherwise, save your dollars and your dignity. You deserve a meal, not a mystery.

Nando‚Äôs at Bugis Junction is a great spot if you‚Äôre craving flavorful flame-grilled chicken with a spicy kick! üçóüî• Their PERi-PERi chicken is always juicy, tender, and grilled to perfection. You can choose your preferred spice level ‚Äì from the mild Lemon & Herb üçãüåø to the fiery Extra Hot üå∂Ô∏è ‚Äì so there‚Äôs something for everyone.

The set meals are a good deal, especially the 1/4 or 1/2 chicken combos with two sides üçΩÔ∏è. I personally love pairing mine with Mediterranean rice üçö and grilled veggies ü•¶. They‚Äôve also got PERi-PERi bowls, wraps, and burgers if you‚Äôre looking for something different ‚Äì all customizable and packed with flavor üòã.

The ambiance is cozy and casual, great for a chill lunch or dinner ü™ëüïØÔ∏è. Service can be a bit slow during peak hours ‚è≥, but the staff are generally friendly and helpful üòä. It‚Äôs usually less crowded during off-peak times, so that‚Äôs the best time to go for a smoother experience üï∞Ô∏è.

If you love bold flavors and don‚Äôt mind a little heat, Nando‚Äôs is definitely worth checking out! ‚úÖ Bonus points for being conveniently located right in Bugis Junction ‚Äì perfect for a meal after shopping or exploring the area üõçÔ∏èüö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.
